titles.title: A bill to amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to clarify the definition of substantial cessation of operations.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

calendar.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. Reported by Senator Harkin with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 552.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
6/19/2014--Introduced. Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) with respect to the treatment as a substantial employer subject to specified liability of any employer that ceases operations at a facility in any location with the result that more than 20% percent of the total number of the employees participating under the employer's single-employer pension plan are separated from employment.
Details the meaning of a substantial cessation of operations.
